intro: Hieracium arcicola, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and rocky or gravelly ground. Its yellowish-orange flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant has hairy stems and leaves adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Hieracium arcicola is often found in meadows and slopes, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
